alert.note: Alert for Bristol Bay (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 29 at 4:38PM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...SNOW AND POTENTIAL WINTRY MIX OF PRECIPITATION EXPECTED FOR BRISTOL BAY THURSDAY AND FRIDAY... Another round of winter weather is set to affect the Bristol Bay area Thursday morning through Friday evening. Snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches are expected for most of Bristol Bay north of King Salmon as a front moves ashore from south to north Thursday and Thursday night. Farther south, snow may mix with or transition entirely to rain, leading to lower snowfall totals. Some uncertainty remains regarding the exact location of where this transition will setup, although current thinking places this between Pilot Point and King Salmon. Within this transition zone, the potential for some freezing rain will exist. Freezing rain, if it materializes, is expected to be brief and produce only minimal ice accumulation before temperatures warm above freezing. Precipitation tapers off Thursday evening as the front pushes north into the Kuskokwim Valley. Thursday night through Friday, precipitation becomes showery in nature. Low level moisture surging off the eastern Bering will remain in place as the mid-levels dry out, leading to the potential for freezing drizzle along the Bristol Bay coast as a cooler airmass moves in behind the front.
